examples: A crystal may contain rotation axes in different directions, defining the polyaxial point-groups. […] The general symbol for a polyaxial point group is n1 n2 n3. The simplest case is 222 in the orthorhombic system with three 2-fold axes at right angles to each other (Figure 4.13a).

entries.meaning: (botany) Axial about more than one axis.
examples: According to Florin, only the Taxaceae cannot be interpreted in terms of the polyaxial concept, since the single terminal ovule shows no evidence of having evolved from a bract and ovuliferous shoot system.
